intro: Psychotria waimamurensis, commonly known as the Waimamur mountain psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the mountainous areas of Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically consumed by birds and other animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
